io.robusta.rra.representation

Interface Representation<Document>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    JsonRepresentation<Document>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GsonRepresentation, JacksonRepresentation, XstreamRepresentation

    public interface Representation<Document>
    Created by Nicolas Zozol for Robusta Code
    Author:
    Nicolas Zozol

      • get

        <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> type)
      throws RepresentationException
        Returns a String value, or throw a RepresentationException if it's not found.

        Use #getValues() to return a collection

        Parameters:
        type - type of the object
        Returns:
        the node value
        Throws:
        RepresentationException - if the key is not found
        See Also:
        get(Class, String)

      • get

        java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key)
                     throws RepresentationException
        Returns a String value, or throw a RepresentationException if it's not found.

        Use #getValues() to return a collection

        Parameters:
        key - name of the searched node
        Returns:
        the node value
        Throws:
        RepresentationException - if the key is not found
        See Also:
        get(Class, String)

      • get

        <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> type,
        java.lang.String key)
      throws RepresentationException
        Returns a value, or throw a RepresentationException if it's not found.

        Usually, the method will return a String or a Number, but if this Representation implements also Mapper, then get() could return a complex object.

        Use #getValues() to return a collection

        Parameters:
        type - type of the returned object
        key - name of the searched node
        Returns:
        the node value
        Throws:
        RepresentationException - if the key is not found

      • getDocument

        Document getDocument()

      • hasPossiblyEmpty

        boolean hasPossiblyEmpty(java.lang.String... keys)
        Returns true if the Representation has the keys as direct child
        Parameters:
        keys - searched keys
        Returns:
        true if the Representation has all keys, false if not

      • has

        boolean has(java.lang.String... keys)
        Returns true if the Representation has not empty values for the specified keys In JSON, empty means null or empty String

        Useful to validate a representation sent by a client

        Parameters:
        keys - searched keys
        Returns:
        true if the Representation has all set keys, false if not

      • getMissingKeys

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMissingKeys()
        Returns the the missing keys when #has() and #hasNotEmpty() was called
        Returns:
        the missing keys
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if #has() or#hasNotEmpty() has not been called

        value - value set

      • add

        Representation add(java.lang.String key,
                 Resource resource,
                 boolean eager)
        Add a new element, even if one of the same key exists or a value to a Json array.
        Parameters:
        key -
        resource -
        eager - : if false, Resource dependencies will show only their ids
        Returns:
        the updated representation

      • addAll

        Representation addAll(java.lang.String key,
                    java.util.List values)
        Add a list of objects to the Representation. If list is empty, an empty node is created.
        Parameters:
        key -
        values -
        Returns:
        the updated representation

      • merge

        Representation merge(java.lang.String keyForCurrent,
                   java.lang.String keyForNew,
                   Representation representation)
        Build a new Representation containing this representation along with the representation parameter Say we have a User, its userRepresentation and we want it merged with its schoolRepresentation

        userRepresentation.merge("user", "school", schoolRepresentation) will give : { user : {id:12, name:"Jo"}, school:{id:3, name:"Harvard", price:40000} }

        Parameters:
        keyForCurrent -
        representation - Representation to merge
        Returns:
        a new merged Representation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if representations are not of the same kind

      • remove

        Representation remove(java.lang.String key)
                      throws RepresentationException
        Removes the first element found with this key
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        the new representation
        Throws:
        RepresentationException - if the struncture is irrelevant for the removal

      • fetch

        Representation fetch(java.lang.String key)
        Find the element and returns it detached. The key can be like 'user.school.adress'
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not point to a valid object

      • copy

        Representation copy()
        Returns a deep copy. Each descending elements of the new structure have different memory adresses.
        Returns:
        a new Representation

      • createNewRepresentation

        Representation createNewRepresentation(java.lang.String json)

      • createNewRepresentation

        Representation createNewRepresentation(java.lang.Object newObject)
        Returns a new Representation object of newObject. This current Representation object is NOT affected.
        Returns:
        a Representation of newObject
